intro: Guatteria latipetala, commonly known as the broad-petioled guatteria, is a species of flowering plant in the family Annonaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in countries like Mexico, Guatemala, and Honduras. The plant is characterized by its large, broad leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. It produces edible, fleshy berries that are often consumed by local communities. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens and conservation programs.
